title: Josh Bostock
text:
Joshua "Josh" Bostock (born 24 January 1974) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s. He played at club level for the <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Red%20Devils">Western Suburbs Red Devils</a> (), the <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain Tigers</a>, the <a href="Adelong%20Batlow%20Bears">Adelong Batlow Bears</a> (in <a href="Batlow%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Batlow, New South Wales</a>, 17-miles south of <a href="Adelong%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Adelong, New South Wales</a>, previously of <a href="Group%209%20Rugby%20League">Group 9 Rugby League</a>), <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 1132</a>), and <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4.
Playing career.
First Division Grand Final appearances.
Josh Bostock played , i.e. number 5, and scored two <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 24-22 victory over <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> in the 1998 <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20Second%20Division">First Division</a> Grand Final at <a href="Galpharm%20Stadium">McAlpine Stadium</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on 26 September 1998.
Club career.
Josh Bostock made hist début for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>, played left-, i.e. number 4, and scored 3-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> (a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a>) in the 46-28 victory over <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a> at <a href="Spotland%20Stadium">Spotland Stadium</a>, <a href="Rochdale">Rochdale</a> on Sunday 7 June 1998.
